result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A. Forster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.  The Defendant is to complete AODA assessment and comply with any treatment recommended.  The Defendant is to abide by all rules and conditions of the Agent.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is to seek and maintain full time employment and/or educational programming as recommended.  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis-fee is waived.

timeConds.notes: Imposed and Stayed - to be used for violations of probation by Agent with Court approval.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Plea hearing on June 4, 2014 at 10:45 am.

The defendant shall appear on all court dates; give written notice to the Clerk of Court  within 48 hours of any change of address or telephone number;  shall not commit any crime; shall neither directly nor indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.
Call the Outagamie County Sheriff's Dept. at (920) 832-5633 within 48 hours for fingerprints and/or photos.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.
